Review Title: A company with a great future ahead of it

The company has come out of its recent financial struggles strongly and the future looks bright.
In most positions if you wish to have a career with this company that option is yours as long as you desire to stay.
Health care benefits are very good.
Cons: Career opportunities seem limited at the moment however the company is working to provide information regarding advancement opportunities to all employees.

Review Title: A once upon a time exceptional company circa 2001
Pros: Company vehicle. An ever changing scope of work and products, you won't get bored.
Cons: Upper management (Executives and Board Members) Diebold Nixdorf management is abhorrent. Absolutely disconnected from its value point. Value point is Integrity. Service Technicians. The customers we serve. Under this leadership employee's as well as investors whom believed in this company have been robbed of our DN stock shares. DN filed bankruptcy leaving us out to hang. No reimbursement, no apology. The very next week after bankruptcy DN is back on the exchange with a stock price of 20.00. This is how they treat there own.

Review Title: Looking for good pay? Not here!
Pros: Good co-workers and supervisors to work with. Benefits are great. Floor supervisors care about you and try to fight for you. Jobs are never hard or confusing. Vacation time is great.
Cons: Pay raises are horrible! Unless you are a white collar worker, you do not matter to the company. You will never advance or progress. You will never be able to afford anything. This is a good temporary job to get you through until you can find a better company to work for, You do get great benefits but the raises do not match the cost for those benefits. Your opinion does not matter and you are expected to perform miracles with low staff and very little resources. They will feed you a free lunch every now and then thinking that it will compensate for their terrible pay and horrible treatment. If you are not applying for a white collar position, this is not the right place to work.

Pros: Great work culture and flexible working hours

Review Title: Good depending on the client account
Pros: Decent pay, decent workload, standard benefits
Cons: Top down bureaucracy can affect the service desk sporadically.

Pros: - The salary is pretty fair. - You can work from home.
Cons: - Team leadership displayed many toxic characteristics, bordering on harassment behavior. - The training is inadequate, as it doesn't equip you to work effectively. Instead of receiving comprehensive and clear preparation that covers everything, you are rushed into the job after just a few weeks. You are handed a set of tools and methods to perform your tasks, but unfortunately, you are left unprepared when you start receiving calls to the point where people on the phone start asking for help with something that you have never heard about. These tools and methods are outdated, causing numerous challenges during the calls. They were plagued with bugs and technical issues, making it difficult to carry out our responsibilities smoothly. This situation not only affected your productivity but also creates unnecessary stress. - It is a very chaotic and confused workplace where nothing seems to be clear at all.

Review Title: Used to be a good company
Pros: When I first started with the company, it was a really good company to work for, well managed, and cared about the employees. Not the case as of now.
Cons: The company has steadily gone away from using permanent employees and is using contractors to do the work. because the contractors are unfamiliar with the work they are contracted to do, the work is of poor quality and takes longer to get done which is reflected in poor customer satisfaction. because the contractors are Temps, if they do not like the job, they just leave the company and go to another job. this has become a black eye for the company which is too bad because it still has great potential, they just need to hire better decision-makers at the top.

Review Title: Good place for call centre exposure
Pros: Fast pace work environment , people come and go very fast. But able to meet good colleagues from other projects as well. If you’re the kind that likes to self learn to expand knowledge, this is the place for you.
Cons: Disconnection between management and employee. Some employee titles have been promoted for 6 months plus yet HR database are not updated include revise renumeration packages unless someone helps you to push it to management to get things done.

Pros: friendly environment. good place to work. no Rush, no pressure
Cons: their support its horrible. they never answer, when they do, they want you to fill out paper forms, send it to them, ten download flight records from machine or 1 touch. and still no good advise. software team same thing, I sincerely believe this company its over staffed I used to have a manager ten they put a manager/co-worker that supposedly he was going to help on hard to fix machines. he doesn't do it and now we have an extra supervisor that its just sitting us. financially company its not doing that great. they need to clean unnecessary people.

Pros: Was a great place to work back in the day.
Cons: Total fear of termination every day of the week.

Pros: Decent pay, usually raises yearly, 2 weeks vacay 1st day of employment
Cons:
**management is horrible. they recently claim to be going through a "change" but will only turn out like the past due to 20yr employee good old boys club will resist change and will not allow it at the lowest level. Management's friends are taken very good care of. if you aren't a friend, you'll be carrying entire team then will be pushed out within 6yr.
***I literally witnessed management allow an employee to come into work 3-4hrs late DAILY for atleast 5 years. Management covered this up by saying the tech works late when needed and can fix whatever they're sent to (which neither was true, he was just a good old boy friend)
You'll earn your decent pay 110% combined with forced overtime and strict strict deadlines and heavy fines for company if fix time isn't met on contracts. the raises do not raise a new employee to former employee wages at all. you'll make 25k less than someone with 15 more yrs at company, no matter your former experience, numbers or calls complete.
*****I appreciate everything I learned and gained from the company ... However thank GOD I'm gone.

Cons: No company parties, no recognitions due to struggling banking business.

Review Title: not a bad place to work for but it has its kinks
Pros: -supervisors are chill -plant manager is chill -great people to work along side - if for what ever reason you should find yourself without anything to do in your department, they will try and find you something else that needs done before thinking about sending you home for the day. - tries to accommodate everyone. - recognizes the great jobs everyone is doing - recognizes individual accomplishments
Cons: - miscommunication unfortunately is a big thing -will get docked half a point for being 2 minutes late - cant seems to keep people ( that can also be dependant on the the individual not just dn's side) - almost always out of parts needed to fully finish order(s) which isnt always the fault of diebold.
